sections.title: Clinician-led digital dentistry in Shoreham-by-Sea
sections.body: Every digital step stays under clinician oversight. We scan, plan, and fabricate with measured control so comfort, precision, and predictability stay aligned from consultation to fit.
bullets: Intra-oral scanning replaces messy impressions for precise data
Planning led by the clinicians who deliver your treatment
In-house production keeps adjustments and remakes within reach
Clear visuals and checkpoints before any treatment begins

sections.eyebrow: Why our digital workflow is different
sections.title: Measured, in-house control from scan to finish
items: Experienced clinicians guiding scans, planning, and material choice
On-site fabrication keeps timelines tight and quality consistent
Controlled workflows reduce remakes and late-stage surprises
Predictable outcomes with documented settings and review points

sections.title: Intra-oral scans for comfort and accuracy
sections.body: We capture detailed scans without trays or putty, giving us precise models for planning. Real-time feedback helps us refine data at the chair so fittings and guides are built on solid information.

sections.title: Preview options with collaborative planning
sections.body: Visual previews show how proposed changes align with your features. We discuss conservative options first, adjust shapes or movement together, and only proceed when the plan feels right clinically and aesthetically.

sections.title: Printed guides, provisionals, and protective appliances
sections.body: We print restorations, dentures, provisionals, and guards on-site using controlled settings. This shortens turnaround, enables same-day refinements, and keeps material choices aligned with your treatment plan.

sections.title: Character and shading guided by clinicians
sections.body: Printed work is tinted and characterised by hand so gums and teeth look natural. Clinicians oversee shade, texture, and gingival detail to ensure every piece harmonises with your smile and bite.

sections.title: Guidance on when printing or lab ceramics serve you best
items: Printed guides, provisionals, and guards are ideal when precision and speed support care
Printed dentures and temporaries help us refine fit before commissioning final work
Complex cosmetic cases may still warrant lab-crafted ceramics for long-term polish
We recommend the approach that keeps your outcome stable, comfortable, and predictable
